item.title: The Problem with 3rd Person 'S'
item.author: Jaqueline Steiger
item.description:
Why Does 3rd-Person -s Take So Long To Stick?

3rd-Person -s is taught early and drilled often in an ESL classroom.

“Suzy runs”

“We run”

It is a simple rule that can be easily understood. And yet it is often and repeatedly forgotten by students, even at a high level.

Here’s the answer:

It serves no real purpose.

It is a redundant morphological function. We already know whether or not the subject of a verb is plural by the other components of the sentence - the subject itself, the subject pronouns, and sometimes words in the predicate.

While it is morphologically important, it is not semantically significant.

Again I say “Take that, Chomsky”.
